paragraphs.text: %md ## OML4SQL Data Cleaning: Outlier Removal In this notebook, we demonstrate how to remove outliers using Oracle SQL and the DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM package. We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set, which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance. In the dataset CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL, we focus on numeric values and remove records with values in the top and bottom 5%. The dataset `CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL` is generated by the `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook, which `MUST` be run before this notebook. --- ##### `IMPORTANT`: The `"OML Run-me-first"` notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook. --- Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation ###### The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0 ---

msg.data:
OML4SQL Data Cleaning: Outlier Removal

In this notebook, we demonstrate how to remove outliers using Oracle SQL and the DBMS_DATA_MINING_TRANSFORM package.

We use the customer insurance lifetime value data set, which contains customer financial information, lifetime value, and whether or not the customer bought insurance.

In the dataset CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL, we focus on numeric values and remove records with values in the top and bottom 5%.

The dataset CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL is generated by the "OML Run-me-first" notebook, which MUST be run before this notebook.

IMPORTANT: The "OML Run-me-first" notebook is available under the menu Templates -> Examples and is a pre-requisite to the current notebook.

Copyright (c) 2023 Oracle Corporation

The Universal Permissive License (UPL), Version 1.0

paragraphs.title: Display CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL data
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT * 
FROM   CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL 
FETCH FIRST 10 ROWS ONLY;

paragraphs.title: Create a view that contains the columns with outliers
paragraphs.text:
%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW CUSTOMER_CLIP_V AS
SELECT CUSTOMER_ID, INCOME
FROM   CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL;

paragraphs.title: View clip boundaries
paragraphs.text:
%sql

SELECT col, lcut, rcut
FROM   clip_tbl
ORDER BY col ASC;

paragraphs.title: Check new min and max of INCOME
paragraphs.text:
%sql
 
SELECT 'PREVIOUS' STATE, MIN(INCOME), MAX(INCOME)
FROM   CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL_STACK
UNION
SELECT 'AFTER' STATE, MIN(INCOME), MAX(INCOME)
FROM   CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV_SQL;
